mdRecord.dcterms:description: 77 ft. tall. In 1889, to celebrate the centennial of George Washington's inauguration as president of the United States, a large plaster and wood Memorial Arch was erected over Fifth Avenue just north of the park. The temporary plaster and wood arch was so popular that in 1892 a permanent marble arch was erected. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_Square_Park [work]
